page.title: 06DAIRY FARMING IN GRAFTON
page.content: In the morning we wake up at half-past five and bring the cows in from a field then we start milking. Milking is done by electrically powered units that suck the milk out of the cows udders. While they are being milked we feed them with cake which is a mixture of minerals and oats. We finish milking at seven a.m. The cows go through some yards and into a field. The field is sometimes divided up with an electric fence so that the cows don't have too much to eat. In the afternoon we milk the cows at three a.m. and finish at half-past five. The milk tanker comes from the milk marketing board and when it has been to all the farms in his area he goes to the dairy where the milk is bottled up or he goes to the creamery where the milk is made into cheese, butter and yoghurt.
